items.title: CEO of nuclear fusion firm Trump Media is merging with: High-velocity capital is critical to build quickly and efficiently. The concerns are secondary
items.description: The so-called merger of equals would make TAE Technologies the first publicly traded fusion energy developer.

items.title: Lovable hits $6.6 billion valuation as its CEO says it wants to be ‘the last piece of software’ companies ever buy
items.description: The Swedish startup raised $330 million as enterprises race to adopt AI-built software.

items.title: ‘This is a wacky number’: economists cry foul as new government data assumes zero housing inflation in surprising November drop
items.description: The culprit, several economists say, is the extended government shutdown.

items.title: The AI efficiency illusion: why cutting 1.1 million jobs will stifle, not scale, your strategy
items.description: The canary in the coal mine for the broader economy is the crisis facing Black women.

items.title: How Salient, an AI loan processing startup valued at $500 million, grew ARR to $25 million in two years
items.description: Salient cofounder Ari Malik built AI to automate loan servicing, turning collections calls into a high-growth business now valued around $500 million.
